turn.2: Tally Hall (soccer) Talmon Henry "Tally" Hall (born May 12, 1985) is an American retired soccer goalkeeper who spent eight of his ten professional seasons in Major League Soccer (MLS) with the Houston Dynamo (2009–2014), Orlando City (2015) and D.C.
turn.5: Did he suffer any injuries during his professional career?
turn.6: He was a starter from 2011 to 2015.
turn.8: Born in SeaTac, Washington, Hall attended Gig Harbor High School, and was a star for the San Diego State Aztecs, where he was a two-time NSCAA and College Soccer News All-American, a semi-finalist for the M.A.C. Hermann Trophy, and a first-team all-Pacific-10 Conference honoree for two straight years.
turn.9: What teams did he play for during his professional career?
turn.10: During his college years, Hall also played with Boulder Rapids Reserve in the USL Premier Development League.
turn.11: What is an interesting fact about his professional career?
turn.12: Although Hall was drafted by Los Angeles Galaxy in the 2007 MLS SuperDraft, Hall signed with Danish club Esbjerg instead.
